item.title: Large pothole at road junction, 3rd February
item.description:
Has been there for months and apart from a temporary repair made on Sunday not effective action has been taken to date. My concerm is this temporary repair will soon fail, what we need is a more substantial repair and ideally some resurfacing, rather than patching repairs. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Way, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Play park is out of action, 3rd February
item.description:
The play park in the meadows has been closed for a while now due to fire/vandalism damage. When will this be fixed and reopened?

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The speed table at the junction of Main Road and the landway is still collapsing, 3rd February
item.description:
The speed table is still collapsing, it was first reported in July 2025 and still nothing has been done about it. It’s in an appalling state particularly going in a southerly direction. There’s always a loud bang even when you drive over it at 5mph because the brickwork (who thought brickwork speed tables were a good idea!) has collapsed so much below the road surface. This needs looking at IMMEDIATELY.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Maylands Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Two potholes, around 8 inches each, 3rd February
item.description:
Two potholes have formed where previously reported repairs have not been carried out. No markings on the highway by a highway inspector which illustrates that this road has not been inspected. These two potholes need to be fixed as a matter of extreme urgency, this is a danger to pedestrians and vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thursland Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overhanging and obstructing pavement, 3rd February
item.description:
This issue was originally reported by me :FixMyStreet ref: 8038697. Hedges at nos 3 and 5 were overhanging and obstructing the pavement. No 3 has now been cut back but no action has been taken on no 5. You have however indicated the case is now closed. Can you please re-open as the matter had not been resolved. Or explain why you have decided not to take any action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
